result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. FENN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • PTC Manufacture Methamphetamine (<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Order Vacating Revocation.
Whereas a revocatoin order and warrant was issued in this matter by the division on 07-20-17.
And whereas the revocation of probation for 14 CF 209 is vacated due to a change in statute by 2017 Act 33 changing Wis. Stat. 961.443(2)(b)1 and the Revocation Order and Warrant was issued after 2017 Act 33 was in effect.
Therefore, it is ordered that the order entered on 07-20-17 regarding case no: 14 CF 209 is vacated.
Copy delivered to DOC.

Order Vacating Sentence.
It is ordered that the sentence the court gave the defendant on 08-11-17 is vacated.  Mr. Fenn will continue on probation with a withheld sentence pursuant to the judgment of conviction entered on 07-01-15.
Copy delivered to DOC.

Minutes.
RE:  Possess paraphernalia to manufacture Methamphetamine, on 04-21-14.

At 2:58 p.m., $1,500.00 cash bail furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess Methamphetamine, possess Methamphetamine paraphernalia, possess materials for manufacturing Methamphetamine and purchase pseudoephedrine products on behalf of another person.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-12-14 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $1,500.00 cash with he condition that he have no contact with Craig Holtz.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
